title: Thunderbird is laggy and locks up
content:
I experience, as man others in the forum, that T-Bird locks the cursor, and everything goes to a halt. You can actually keep typing, and most of the text will appear when the "lag is over". The issue started more than a year ago when I set up a new laptop with pre installed W10, so it was a blank installation of T-Bird. I fiddled a bit with the below registry settings, it primarily take care of resource eating nonsense from MS - it helped a bit, not much.

All this just to say, you have a problem at the T-Bird developer team, I'm not the only person reporting this, but support don't know their head from the tail.

I'm running WIN10 and have no plans of upgrading for now.

I'm not suspecting the computer which is a new one with an I7 processor and 16Gb RAM

================================================================

Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\location] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\webcam] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\microphone] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\userNotificationListener] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\activity] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\userAccountInformation] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\phoneCallHistory] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\email] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\userDataTasks] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\chat] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\radios] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\bluetoothSync] "[Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Search] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\appDiagnostics] "Value"="Deny"

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\documentsLibrary] "Value"="Deny"

title: Can't see messages in inbox
content: Strange issue just happened to me. I have several email accounts in Thunderbird v102.14.0. Only having a problem with my Hotmail account inbox. I'm unable to see any messages in the inbox. The messages are there, but they don't show. If I click an area in the inbox, the message displays. The other folders in this account display. Only having a problem with the inbox. Hope this makes sense to someone that can help me me able to see inbox messages. I tried a PC restart, but that was no help. Compacted that folder too.
creator: illroute66

title: Access to Telstra mail is suddenly not available
content: For years I have accessed my email "graham.kruck@bigpond.com" via Thunderbird. Suddenly I could not access it except via webmail. Is this a problem with Thunderbird or Telstra please? It is so frustrating trying to speak to someone to sort out these issues but maybe you can advise me who to call if this is not in your domain. Thanks, Graham
creator: graham.kruck
